definitions.definition: a person whose job involves examining facts or materials in order to give an opinion on them

examples.text: He's a **senior** research **analyst** at Deutsche Bank.
City analysts forecast huge profits this year.
According to music **industry analysts**, music downloads are set to decline by as much as 30 per cent this year.
She's an investment analyst with a big City firm.
This view is backed up by several independent political analysts in Washington.

definitions.definition: a person who treats patients using psychoanalysis

wordOrigin: mid 17th cent.: from French analyste, from the verb analyser, from medieval Latin analysis from Greek analusis, from analuein ‘unloose’, from ana- ‘up’ + luein ‘loosen’.
